conclusion: To determine if the displacements of cars A and B are the same during the time period from t=0 to t=t1, we need to analyze the area under the velocity-time graphs for both cars.
The area under the velocity-time graph gives the displacement of the car.
For Car A, the area under the graph is the area of the region bounded by the curve v_A(t), the time axis, and the vertical lines at t=0 and t=t1.
For Car B, the area under the graph is the area of the region bounded by the curve v_B(t), the time axis, and the vertical lines at t=0 and t=t1.
The graph shows that the area under the curve for Car A is greater than the area under the curve for Car B.
The area under the curve for Car A is greater than the area under the curve for Car B because the curve for Car A is above the curve for Car B for the entire time interval 0 ≤ t ≤ t1.
Since the area under the curve for Car A is greater than the area under the curve for Car B, the displacement of Car A is greater than the displacement of Car B.
The displacements of cars A and B are not the same.
